item.description:
This isnt only a sunset paddle on the water..
Its a few rescue things that ya need to see and try...
not complicated..but something ya will remember...and might just use someday...

Not Charging for the yaks either here..you being able to save your buddy is priceless...

The biggest thing here is to get some of you able to do a self rescue, and then a assist rescue for one of your paddling buddies..

Paddle float re-entry...empting a recreational boat..not as easy as you think..maybe a T rescue..or a few other things that work...test out your PFD and find out it isnt that good...etc..but then you know...its all still ok...just know things limits...


so far things have worked out ok...but even the farmington river has its hazards..those tree branches, some current, etc...
Im not able to rescue most of you..for obvious reasons..some nearby but thats it..so i need a few others who can assist in rescues..Just in case.....THE CT RIVER is not as forgiving as the farmington..and i have a few more events planned there...and along the shore...


the ocean coves are actually ok (most of the time) bad weather well its fun if you can handle it..., but out more than a mile (or less) in the ocean...ya better know how to get back in and fast.......and have some other stuff...spray skirt..im mixed on them for close proximity to shore..or in tree branches areas..but they have their purposes as you learn the advanced stuff...no need to get one unless you plan on ocean things, or learning rolls , bracing..etc.....but with rec yaks...i would rather have you in the water fast without impedance..

This isnt a far distance paddle, just around the lake and beach area till it gets dark doing practice things...YOU do a few of them...they are GET wet things...the water is pretty clean here so dont worry..its not like the CT River...
practice here and ya wont get the CT river in your boat or your nose and mouth...then get worms or worse...

Bring a flashlight just in case we enjoy the area more than we plan...

We can add some other activity later..
There is a real interesting tunnel a mile away..OHH its Friday The 13...creepy creatures...if some of you that are interested..(last time it was pretty good)...yep the old fire pit and grill work here too...

RAIN Backup Plan... i will post update if needed
but rain cancelss the event...

Getting there:
There is a easy to reach boat launch right off of rte 44 in Bolton that has plenty of parking and PortaPotties at the parking lot . Further to the east on the lake is a beach area that would be an excellent place to sit on the sand to eat some snacks. And to practice paddle float entries...if you have not one of these things...its a real life saver....
you will see why..oh yeh and a pump...sponge , bail bucket..is ok too..but no where near the capacity of a good pump...
Reason 1..standing in the mud up to your waiste is not fun if you even make it that far to the shore..most likely you are going to die here like those stickey traps for mice....reason 2 :better to pop back in fast, pump out fast and get going...There is hungry LEACHES, EELS, and Frankenstein Fish in there....

Directions:
Rte 384 East to Bolton Notch (off of rte 84 in East Hartford / Manchester line area)
Follow 384 to the end..
Continue on Rte 44 E (left part of fork) rte 6 is to the right, stay on 44
There is a traffic light with a post office and a small shopping area to the right, continue to the next light.
The next light has the boat launch to the left and a church to the right. (across from South Road)
Enter the boat launch area.
I carry my kayak on a old sailboat trailer so im easy to spot.

Mapquest, GPS and others use 1,000 Boston Turnpike (rte 44) Bolton to get you close enough..
